intro: Manettia angamarcensis, commonly known as the Angamarcensis bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, making it a visually appealing species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
